org.reactfx

Class EventStreamBase<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.reactfx.EventStreamBase<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of events emitted by this event stream.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventStream<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectableEventSource, EventSource

    public abstract class EventStreamBase<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventStream<T>
    Base class for event streams. Adds support for error propagation on top of ObservableBase.

    • Method Detail

      • emit

        protected final void emit(T value)

      • runUnsafeAction

        protected final boolean runUnsafeAction(java.lang.Runnable action)
        Runs the given action. If action does not throw an exception, returns true. If action throws an exception, then the implementation may either let that exception propagate, or handle the exception and return false.
        Parameters:
        action - action to execute. May throw an exception.

      • reportError

        protected final void reportError(java.lang.Throwable thrown)
        Notifies all registered error handlers of the given error.

      • subscribeTo

        protected final <U> Subscription subscribeTo(EventStream<U> stream,
                                             java.util.function.Consumer<? super U> subscriber)
        Subscribes to the given event stream by the given subscriber and also forwards errors reported by the given stream to this stream. This is equivalent to stream.subscribe(subscriber, this::reportError).
        Returns:
        subscription used to unsubscribe subscriber from stream and stop forwarding the errors.

      • subscribe

        public final Subscription subscribe(Subscriber<? super T> subscriber)
        Description copied from interface: EventStream
        Get notified every time this event stream emits a value or encounters an error. An error is encountered when a user provided function (e.g. an event subscriber or an argument to a stream combinator, such as EventStream.map(Function)), throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface EventStream<T>
        Parameters:
        subscriber - handles emitted events and encountered errors.
        Returns:
        subscription that can be used to stop observing this event stream.

      • subscribeToInputs

        protected abstract Subscription subscribeToInputs()
        Starts observing this observable's input(s), if any. This method is called when the number of observers goes from 0 to 1. This method is called before newObserver(Object) is called for the first observer.
        Returns:
        subscription used to stop observing inputs. The subscription is unsubscribed (i.e. input observation stops) when the number of observers goes down to 0.

      • isBound

        protected final boolean isBound()

      • getObserverCount

        protected final int getObserverCount()

      • notifyObservers

        protected final void notifyObservers(java.util.function.BiConsumer<O,T> notifier,
                                     T event)

      • forEachObserver

        protected final void forEachObserver(java.util.function.Consumer<O> action)
        Executes action for each observer, regardless of recursion state. If action throws an exception for one observer, it will not be called for any subsequent observers and the exception will be propagated by this method.
        Parameters:
        action - action to execute for each observer.

      • newObserver

        protected void newObserver(O observer)
        Called for each new observer. Overriding this method is a convenient way for subclasses to handle this event, for example to publish some initial events.

        This method is called after the subscribeToInputs() method.

      • observe

        protected final Subscription observe(O observer)
